ground_truth: Marcus and Willie are in the back room, where a ladder leads up to the air vent. Willie snaps a popper, causing Marcus to glare at him. While the guard bids farewell to shoppers, Marcus crawls through the vent. Once Willie and the last of the shoppers have gone, the security guard checks his watch and taps a code into the alarm system. Marcus is in the air conditioning duct overlooking the security booth and presses a button on a remote control, switching off all the security cameras, then hurries back along the duct. He plunges down the duct, heading straight down, and smashes through a vent above a table of sweaters Lois had repositioned to break his fall. The table collapses, and he leaps to his feet, running to the alarm console and turning it off with two seconds to spare. A service elevator opens, and Marcus and Willie step out, Willie towing a trolley of safe-cracking equipment. They break into an office, and Marcus walks over to a large safe, with Willie staring at it aghast. Still staring at the safe, Willie sits down, and later he tries to crack the combination, while Marcus wheels a handcart through the mall. At home, Thurmond carefully lays the table for dinner and selects a bottle of wine. Marcus is on his annual shopping spree, helping himself to all the various goodies Lois had listed. Having failed with the combination, Willie falls back on drilling to crack the safe, grimacing as he withdraws the bit from the door. Next, he dons dark goggles and tries to cut his way in with an arc welder, but the welding doesn't go well. At home, Sue takes a sauce bottle from the fridge and hands it to Thurmond. Meanwhile, Marcus takes a red camisole off a shop dummy and kisses its left breast, then comes to the dummy modeling the mink stole, which is too tall for him to reach. After jumping up and down a bit, he catches his breath and spots another mannequin holding a golf club. He takes the club and tries to remove the stole from around the dummy's neck with it, but it won't budge. Eventually, he gives up and uses the club like an ax to chop the dummy's legs off. Down in the office, Willie has resorted to brute force and uses a sledgehammer on the safe door. Willie doesn’t crack the safe, but Marcus succeeds in felling the dummy and takes the stole from around its neck. Willie listens to the back of the safe and taps it as Marcus comes into the office just as Willie emerges from around the back of the safe.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Marcus and Willie are in the rear chamber, where a stepladder ascends up to the air shaft. Willie snaps a firecracker, prompting Marcus to glower at him. While the guard bids farewell to customers, Marcus crawls through the shaft. Once Willie and the last of the customers have departed, the security guard checks his watch and inputs a sequence into the alarm system. Marcus is in the air conditioning duct overlooking the security kiosk and presses a button on a remote control, deactivating all the security cameras, then hurries back along the duct. He drops down the duct, heading straight down, and shatters through a grille above a table of sweaters Lois had repositioned to break his fall. The table collapses, and he springs to his feet, running to the alarm console and turning it off with two seconds to spare. A service lift opens, and Marcus and Willie step out, Willie towing a cart of safe-cracking apparatus. They break into an office, and Marcus walks over to a sizable vault, with Willie staring at it aghast. Still staring at the vault, Willie sits down, and later he attempts to decipher the combination, while Marcus wheels a dolly through the mall. At home, Thurmond meticulously sets the table for dinner and selects a bottle of wine. Marcus is on his yearly shopping spree, helping himself to all the various treats Lois had listed. Having failed with the combination, Willie resorts to drilling to unlock the vault, grimacing as he extracts the drill bit from the door. Next, he dons dark goggles and attempts to cut his way in with an arc welder, but the welding doesn't go smoothly. At home, Sue takes a sauce bottle from the fridge and presents it to Thurmond. Meanwhile, Marcus takes a red camisole off a shop dummy and kisses its left breast, then arrives at the dummy modeling the mink stole, which is too tall for him to reach. After jumping up and down a bit, he catches his breath and notices another mannequin holding a golf club. He takes the club and tries to remove the stole from around the dummy's neck with it, but it won't move. Eventually, he relinquishes and uses the club like an ax to chop the dummy's legs off. Down in the office, Willie has resorted to brute force and uses a sledgehammer on the vault door. Willie doesn’t unlock the vault, but Marcus succeeds in felling the dummy and takes the stole from around its neck. Willie listens to the back of the vault and taps it as Marcus comes into the office just as Willie emerges from around the back of the vault.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Marcus and Willie are in the back room, where a ladder leads up to the air vent. A popper is snapped by Willie, causing Marcus to glare at him. While farewell is bid to shoppers by the guard, the vent is crawled through by Marcus. Once Willie and the last of the shoppers have gone, his watch is checked by the security guard and he taps a code into the alarm system. Marcus is in the air conditioning duct overlooking the security booth and a button is pressed by him on a remote control, switching off all the security cameras, then he hurries back along the duct. He plunges down the duct, heading straight down, and a vent above a table of sweaters Lois had repositioned to break his fall is smashed through by him. The table collapses, and to his feet, he leaps, running to the alarm console and turning it off with two seconds to spare. A service elevator opens, and out step Marcus and Willie, with Willie towing a trolley of safe-cracking equipment. An office is broken into by them, and a large safe is walked over to by Marcus, with Willie staring at it aghast. Still staring at the safe, Willie sits down, and later the combination is tried to be cracked by him while a handcart is wheeled through the mall by Marcus. At home, the table for dinner is carefully laid by Thurmond, and a bottle of wine is selected by him. Marcus is on his annual shopping spree, helping himself to all the various goodies Lois had listed. Having failed with the combination, drilling is used by Willie to crack the safe, grimacing as the bit is withdrawn by him from the door. Next, dark goggles are donned by him and he tries to cut his way in with an arc welder, but he doesn’t succeed with the welding. At home, a sauce bottle is taken from the fridge by Sue and handed to Thurmond. Meanwhile, a red camisole is taken off a shop dummy by Marcus, and its left breast is kissed by him, then he comes to the dummy modeling the mink stole, which is too tall for him to reach. After jumping up and down a bit, his breath is caught by him and another mannequin holding a golf club is spotted by him. The club is taken by him and he tries to remove the stole from around the dummy's neck with it, but it won't budge. Eventually, he gives up and uses the club like an ax to chop the dummy's legs off. Down in the office, brute force is resorted to by Willie, and a sledgehammer is used by him on the safe door. The safe isn’t cracked by Willie, but the dummy is felled by Marcus, and the stole is taken from around its neck by him. The back of the safe is listened to by Willie and it is tapped as Marcus comes into the office just as Willie emerges from around the back of the safe.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Marcus and Willie are in the back room, where a ladder leads to the air vent. Willie snaps a popper, making Marcus glare. As the guard bids farewell to shoppers, Marcus crawls through the vent. Once Willie and the last shoppers leave, the guard checks his watch and enters a code into the alarm system. Marcus, in the duct above the security booth, uses a remote to disable the cameras and hurries back. He plunges down, smashing through a vent above a table of sweaters Lois had moved to break his fall. The table collapses, and he runs to the alarm console, turning it off with two seconds left. A service elevator opens, and Marcus and Willie exit, Willie towing safe-cracking gear. They break into an office, and Marcus approaches a large safe, with Willie staring in shock. Willie attempts to crack the combination while Marcus wheels a handcart through the mall. At home, Thurmond sets the dinner table and selects wine. Marcus is on his annual shopping spree, taking items Lois listed. Failing with the combination, Willie drills the safe, grimacing as he withdraws the bit. He then tries cutting with an arc welder, but it fails. At home, Sue hands Thurmond a sauce bottle. Meanwhile, Marcus takes a red camisole from a dummy and kisses it, then struggles to reach a mink stole on another dummy. Using a golf club, he tries to remove the stole but ends up chopping the dummy's legs off. In the office, Willie uses a sledgehammer on the safe door. Willie doesn’t crack the safe, but Marcus succeeds in taking the stole. Willie listens and taps the safe as Marcus enters the office just as Willie emerges from behind it.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Marcus and Willie are in the back room with a ladder to the air vent. Willie snaps a popper, annoying Marcus. As the guard bids farewell to shoppers, Marcus crawls through the vent. After Willie and the shoppers leave, the guard sets the alarm. Marcus, in the duct above the security booth, uses a remote to disable cameras and returns through the duct, crashing through a vent onto a table of sweaters Lois had moved. The table collapses, and Marcus turns off the alarm with two seconds left. A service elevator opens, and Marcus and Willie exit, Willie with safe-cracking tools. They break into an office, and Marcus approaches a large safe, while Willie stares. Willie attempts to crack the combination as Marcus wheels a cart through the mall. At home, Thurmond sets the dinner table and chooses wine. Marcus, on his annual spree, takes items Lois listed. Failing the combination, Willie drills the safe, then tries an arc welder unsuccessfully. At home, Sue hands Thurmond a sauce bottle. Marcus kisses a red camisole on a dummy, then struggles to reach a mink stole. Using a golf club, he chops the dummy's legs to get the stole. Willie uses a sledgehammer on the safe but fails. Marcus enters as Willie emerges from behind the safe.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
In the dimly lit back room, Marcus and Willie find themselves standing where a sturdy ladder leads upward to the air vent. Willie, with a mischievous glint in his eye, snaps a popper, which causes Marcus to shoot a sharp glare in his direction. Meanwhile, as the security guard bids a polite farewell to the last of the departing shoppers, Marcus begins his stealthy crawl through the narrow confines of the vent. Once Willie and the final group of shoppers have exited, the diligent security guard checks his watch with a practiced glance and proceeds to tap a specific code into the alarm system. Marcus, now positioned within the air conditioning duct that overlooks the security booth, presses a button on a remote control device, effectively switching off all the security cameras, and then quickly makes his way back along the duct. He plunges downward through the duct, heading straight down, and crashes through a vent situated above a table of sweaters that Lois had strategically repositioned to cushion his fall. The table collapses under the impact, and Marcus swiftly leaps to his feet, sprinting to the alarm console and managing to turn it off with a mere two seconds to spare. 

At that moment, a service elevator opens, and Marcus and Willie step out, with Willie towing behind him a trolley laden with safe-cracking equipment. They proceed to break into an office, and Marcus walks over to a large, imposing safe, while Willie stares at it in disbelief. Still fixated on the safe, Willie sits down, and later he attempts to crack the combination, while Marcus wheels a handcart through the bustling mall. Meanwhile, at home, Thurmond meticulously lays the table for dinner and thoughtfully selects a bottle of wine. Marcus is on his annual shopping spree, helping himself to all the various goodies that Lois had carefully listed. Having failed to crack the combination, Willie resorts to drilling in an attempt to open the safe, grimacing as he withdraws the drill bit from the door. Next, he dons a pair of dark goggles and tries to cut his way in using an arc welder, but the welding process does not go as planned. At home, Sue retrieves a sauce bottle from the fridge and hands it to Thurmond. Meanwhile, Marcus takes a red camisole off a shop dummy and kisses its left breast, then approaches the dummy modeling the mink stole, which is unfortunately too tall for him to reach. After jumping up and down a few times, he pauses to catch his breath and spots another mannequin holding a golf club. He takes the club and attempts to remove the stole from around the dummy's neck with it, but it stubbornly refuses to budge. Eventually, he gives up and uses the club like an ax to chop the dummy's legs off. Down in the office, Willie has resorted to brute force, wielding a sledgehammer against the safe door. Although Willie doesn’t manage to crack the safe, Marcus succeeds in toppling the dummy and takes the stole from around its neck. Willie listens intently to the back of the safe and taps it as Marcus enters the office just as Willie emerges from around the back of the safe.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
In the dimly lit confines of the back room, where shadows play tricks on the eye, Marcus and Willie find themselves standing at the base of a sturdy ladder, which extends upwards towards the air vent above. Willie, with a mischievous glint sparkling in his eye, snaps a popper, causing Marcus to shoot him a sharp glare full of irritation and unspoken reprimand. Meanwhile, as the security guard graciously bids farewell to the last of the departing shoppers, Marcus begins his stealthy maneuver, crawling through the narrow and confining spaces of the vent. Once Willie and the final group of shoppers have exited, the diligent security guard, with a practiced and experienced glance at his watch, proceeds to tap a specific code into the alarm system with precision. Now positioned within the air conditioning duct that provides a vantage point overlooking the security booth, Marcus presses a button on a remote control device, effectively disabling all the security cameras, and then hastily makes his way back along the duct. He plunges downward through the duct, making a direct descent, and crashes through the vent situated above a table of sweaters that Lois had strategically placed to cushion his fall. The table collapses under the impact, but Marcus swiftly regains his footing, leaping to his feet and sprinting to the alarm console, managing to turn it off with a mere two seconds to spare. 

At that very moment, a service elevator opens, and Marcus, together with Willie, steps out, with Willie towing behind him a trolley that’s laden with an array of safe-cracking equipment. They proceed to break into an office, and Marcus purposefully walks over to the large, imposing safe, while Willie stares at it in disbelief and awe. Still fixated on the formidable safe, Willie sits down, later attempting to crack the combination, while Marcus wheels a handcart through the bustling mall. Meanwhile, back at home, Thurmond meticulously lays the table for dinner, thoughtfully selecting a bottle of wine to complement the meal. Marcus is on his annual shopping spree, helping himself to all the various goodies that Lois had carefully and thoughtfully listed. Having failed to crack the combination, Willie resorts to drilling in a determined attempt to open the safe, grimacing as he withdraws the drill bit from the door with frustration. Next, he dons a pair of dark goggles and tries to cut his way in using an arc welder, but the welding process does not go as planned and yields no success. At home, Sue retrieves a sauce bottle from the fridge, handing it to Thurmond with a smile. Meanwhile, Marcus takes a red camisole from a shop dummy and kisses its left breast playfully, then approaches the dummy modeling a luxurious mink stole, which, unfortunately, is too tall for him to reach easily. After jumping up and down a few times in a futile attempt, he pauses to catch his breath, then spots another mannequin holding a golf club. He takes the club and attempts to remove the stole from around the dummy's neck with it, but it stubbornly refuses to budge. Eventually, giving up on finesse, he uses the club like an ax to chop the dummy's legs off. Down in the office, Willie has resorted to brute force, wielding a sledgehammer with determination against the unyielding safe door. Although Willie doesn’t manage to crack the safe, Marcus succeeds in toppling the dummy and takes the stole from around its neck triumphantly. Willie listens intently to the back of the safe and taps it with calculated precision as Marcus enters the office just as Willie emerges from around the back of the safe, their paths crossing in that moment of shared endeavor.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: In the back room, Marcus and Willie find themselves standing before a ladder that ascends to the air vent, a crucial part of their plan. Willie, with a mischievous glint in his eye, snaps a popper, the sound echoing in the confined space and drawing a sharp glare from Marcus, who is focused on the task ahead. Meanwhile, outside the room, the security guard is engaged in his routine, bidding farewell to the last of the shoppers as they exit the premises. Seizing the moment, Marcus begins his ascent, carefully crawling through the narrow confines of the vent. As the final shopper departs and Willie follows suit, the security guard, now alone, checks his watch with a practiced glance and proceeds to tap a code into the alarm system, ensuring the building is secure. Unbeknownst to him, Marcus is already positioned within the air conditioning duct, peering down at the security booth below. With a calculated press of a button on his remote control, Marcus deftly switches off all the security cameras, plunging the surveillance system into darkness. He then hastens back along the duct, moving with urgency. Reaching a vertical section, he plunges downwards, his descent culminating in a dramatic crash through a vent positioned above a strategically placed table of sweaters, which Lois had thoughtfully repositioned to cushion his fall. The table collapses under the impact, but Marcus is undeterred, springing to his feet with agility and sprinting towards the alarm console. With mere seconds to spare, he successfully deactivates the alarm system. At this moment, a service elevator opens, revealing Marcus and Willie stepping out, with Willie in tow, pulling a trolley laden with safe-cracking equipment. They make their way into an office, where Marcus approaches a large safe, his eyes fixed on it with determination, while Willie stares at it in disbelief. Still fixated on the safe, Willie lowers himself into a seated position, contemplating his next move. Later, he attempts to crack the combination, his concentration unbroken, as Marcus wheels a handcart through the mall, gathering items for his annual shopping spree, indulging in the various goodies Lois had meticulously listed. Back in the office, having failed to crack the combination, Willie resorts to drilling, his face contorting in frustration as he withdraws the drill bit from the safe's door. Undeterred, he dons a pair of dark goggles and attempts to cut his way in with an arc welder, but the welding process proves unsuccessful. Meanwhile, at home, Thurmond is meticulously laying the table for dinner, selecting a bottle of wine with care. In the mall, Marcus, in the midst of his spree, takes a red camisole from a shop dummy, planting a playful kiss on its left breast. He then approaches another dummy, this one modeling a mink stole, but its height poses a challenge. After a few futile jumps, he pauses to catch his breath and notices another mannequin holding a golf club. Seizing the club, he attempts to dislodge the stole from the dummy's neck, but it remains stubbornly in place. Frustrated, he abandons finesse and uses the club like an ax, chopping the dummy's legs off to bring it down. Meanwhile, in the office, Willie, having exhausted his options, resorts to brute force, wielding a sledgehammer against the safe door. Despite his efforts, the safe remains unyielding, but Marcus, having successfully felled the dummy, triumphantly retrieves the stole from around its neck. As Willie listens intently to the back of the safe, tapping it in a last-ditch effort, Marcus enters the office just as Willie emerges from behind the safe, their efforts converging in the shared space.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Marcus and Willie are in the back room, where a ladder leads up to the air vent. Willie snaps a popper, causing Marcus to glare at him. As the guard bids farewell to shoppers, Marcus crawls through the vent. Once Willie and the last of the shoppers have gone, the security guard checks his watch and activates the alarm system. Marcus, positioned in the air conditioning duct above the security booth, disables the security cameras with a remote control and quickly returns along the duct. He descends rapidly, crashing through a vent above a table of sweaters Lois had repositioned to break his fall. The table collapses, and he swiftly turns off the alarm with two seconds to spare. A service elevator opens, and Marcus and Willie emerge, with Willie towing a trolley of safe-cracking equipment. They break into an office, where Marcus approaches a large safe, and Willie, initially stunned, attempts to crack the combination while Marcus wheels a handcart through the mall. At home, Thurmond prepares the dinner table and selects a bottle of wine. Marcus embarks on his annual shopping spree, collecting various items Lois had listed. After failing with the combination, Willie resorts to drilling and then tries cutting with an arc welder, but both attempts are unsuccessful. At home, Sue hands Thurmond a sauce bottle from the fridge. Meanwhile, Marcus takes a red camisole from a shop dummy and kisses its left breast, then struggles to reach a mink stole on a taller mannequin. After some effort, he uses a golf club to chop the dummy's legs off and retrieves the stole. Down in the office, Willie uses a sledgehammer on the safe door but doesn't succeed. Marcus enters the office as Willie emerges from behind the safe.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Marcus and Willie are in the back room of a department store, where a ladder leads up to the air vent designed for maintenance access. Willie snaps a popper, a small device that makes a loud noise and is often used for pranks, causing Marcus to glare at him. While the guard, who usually finishes his shift at the end of the business day, bids farewell to shoppers, Marcus crawls through the vent, a cramped space used to circulate air throughout the building. Once Willie and the last of the shoppers have gone, the security guard checks his watch, a habit from his military days, and taps a code into the alarm system, ensuring the premises are secure. Marcus is in the air conditioning duct overlooking the security booth, a strategic point for monitoring activity, and presses a button on a remote control designed for disabling electronics, switching off all the security cameras, then hurries back along the duct. He plunges down the duct, heading straight down, and smashes through a vent above a table of sweaters that Lois, a meticulous store employee, had repositioned earlier to break his fall. The table collapses, and he leaps to his feet, running to the alarm console, a sophisticated device linked to the store’s security network, and turning it off with two seconds to spare. A service elevator, used primarily for transporting goods between floors, opens, and Marcus and Willie step out, Willie towing a trolley of safe-cracking equipment that he had borrowed from a friend with questionable connections. They break into an office, the administrative heart of the store, and Marcus walks over to a large safe, with Willie staring at it aghast, overwhelmed by its size and complexity. Still staring at the safe, Willie sits down, and later he tries to crack the combination, while Marcus wheels a handcart through the mall, an upscale shopping center bustling with evening shoppers. At home, Thurmond, an old friend of Marcus, carefully lays the table for dinner and selects a bottle of wine, a rare vintage he had been saving for a special occasion. Marcus is on his annual shopping spree, helping himself to all the various goodies Lois had meticulously listed in preparation for the holiday season. Having failed with the combination, Willie falls back on drilling to crack the safe, grimacing as he withdraws the bit from the door, a technique he learned from watching heist movies. Next, he dons dark goggles and tries to cut his way in with an arc welder, but the welding doesn't go well, reflecting his lack of experience with such equipment. At home, Sue, an accomplished chef, takes a sauce bottle from the fridge and hands it to Thurmond, who is preparing dinner. Meanwhile, Marcus takes a red camisole off a shop dummy, an elegant display figure, and kisses its left breast, then comes to the dummy modeling the mink stole, which is too tall for him to reach. After jumping up and down a bit, he catches his breath and spots another mannequin holding a golf club, a prop intended to attract the attention of sports enthusiasts. He takes the club and tries to remove the stole from around the dummy's neck with it, but it won't budge. Eventually, he gives up and uses the club like an ax to chop the dummy's legs off, a destructive but effective solution. Down in the office, Willie has resorted to brute force and uses a sledgehammer on the safe door, a last-ditch effort to break it open. Willie doesn’t crack the safe, but Marcus succeeds in felling the dummy and takes the stole from around its neck. Willie listens to the back of the safe, a classic heist move, and taps it as Marcus comes into the office just as Willie emerges from around the back of the safe, defeated but determined to try again.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. Next he dons dark goggles and tries to cut his way in with an arc welder but the welding does not go well. At home Sue takes a sauce bottle from the fridge and hands it to Thurmond. Meanwhile Marcus takes a red camisole off a shop dummy and kisses its left breast. then comes to the dummy modeling the mink stole which is too tall for him to reach. After jumping up and down a bit he catches his breath and spots another mannequin holding a golf club. He takes the club and tries to remove the stole from around the dummy's neck with it but it will not budge. Eventually he gives up and uses the club like an ax to chop the dummy's legs off. Down in the office Willie has resorted to brute force and uses a sledgehammer on the safe door. Willie does not crack the safe but Marcus succeeds in felling the dummy and takes the stole from around its neck. Willie listens to the back of the safe and taps it as Marcus comes into the office just as Willie emerges from around the back of the safe.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Marcus and Willie are in the back room where a ladder leads up to the air vent. Willie snaps a popper causing Marcus to glare at him. While the guard bids farewell to shoppers Marcus crawls through the vent. Once Willie and the last of the shoppers have gone the security guard checks his watch and taps a code into the alarm system. Marcus is in the air conditioning duct overlooking the security booth and presses a button on a remote control switching off all the security cameras then hurries back along the duct. He plunges down the duct heading straight down and smashes through a vent above a table of sweaters Lois had repositioned to break his fall. The table collapses and he leaps to his feet running to the alarm console and turning it off with two seconds to spare. A service elevator opens and Marcus and Willie step out. Willie towing a trolley of safecracking equipment. They break into an office and Marcus walks over to a large safe with Willie staring at it aghast. Still staring at the safe Willie sits down and later he tries to crack the combination while Marcus wheels a handcart through the mall. At home Thurmond carefully lays the table for dinner and selects a bottle of wine. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Marcus is on his annual shopping spree helping himself to all the various goodies Lois had listed. Having failed with the combination Willie falls back on drilling to crack the safe grimacing as he withdraws the bit from the door. Next he dons dark goggles and tries to cut his way in with an arc welder but the welding does not go well. At home Sue takes a sauce bottle from the fridge and hands it to Thurmond. Meanwhile Marcus takes a red camisole off a shop dummy and kisses its left breast. then comes to the dummy modeling the mink stole which is too tall for him to reach. After jumping up and down a bit he catches his breath and spots another mannequin holding a golf club. He takes the club and tries to remove the stole from around the dummy's neck with it but it will not budge. Eventually he gives up and uses the club like an ax to chop the dummy's legs off. Down in the office Willie has resorted to brute force and uses a sledgehammer on the safe door. Willie does not crack the safe but Marcus succeeds in felling the dummy and takes the stole from around its neck. Willie listens to the back of the safe and taps it as Marcus comes into the office just as Willie emerges from around the back of the safe.

test_cases.description: Marcus and Willie are in the back room where a ladder leads up to the air vent. Willie snaps a popper causing Marcus to glare at him. While the guard bids farewell to shoppers Marcus crawls through the vent. Once Willie and the last of the shoppers have gone the security guard checks his watch and taps a code into the alarm system. Marcus is in the air conditioning duct overlooking the security booth and presses a button on a remote control switching off all the security cameras then hurries back along the duct. He plunges down the duct heading straight down and smashes through a vent above a table of sweaters Lois had repositioned to break his fall. After jumping up and down a bit he catches his breath and spots another mannequin holding a golf club. He takes the club and tries to remove the stole from around the dummy's neck with it but it will not budge. Eventually he gives up and uses the club like an ax to chop the dummy's legs off. Down in the office Willie has resorted to brute force and uses a sledgehammer on the safe door. Willie does not crack the safe but Marcus succeeds in felling the dummy and takes the stole from around its neck. Willie listens to the back of the safe and taps it as Marcus comes into the office just as Willie emerges from around the back of the safe.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Marcus and Willie are in the back room where a ladder leads up to the air vent. Willie snaps a popper causing Marcus to glare at him. While the guard bids farewell to shoppers Marcus crawls through the vent. Willie does not crack the safe but Marcus succeeds in felling the dummy and takes the stole from around its neck. Willie listens to the back of the safe and taps it as Marcus comes into the office just as Willie emerges from around the back of the safe.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Charlene and Max are in the back room, where a ladder leads up to the air vent. Max snaps a popper, causing Charlene to glare at him. While the musician bids farewell to shoppers, Charlene crawls through the vent. Once Max and the last of the shoppers have gone, the librarian checks his watch and taps a code into the alarm system. Charlene is in the air conditioning duct overlooking the security booth and presses a button on a remote control, switching off all the security cameras, then hurries back along the duct. She plunges down the duct, heading straight down, and smashes through a vent above a table of sweaters Caroline had repositioned to break her fall. The table collapses, and she leaps to her feet, running to the alarm console and turning it off with two seconds to spare. A service elevator opens, and Charlene and Max step out, Max towing a trolley of safe-cracking equipment. They break into an office, and Charlene walks over to a large safe, with Max staring at it aghast. Still staring at the safe, Max sits down, and later he tries to crack the combination, while Charlene wheels a handcart through the mall. At home, Jackson carefully lays the table for dinner and selects a bottle of wine. Charlene is on her annual shopping spree, helping herself to all the various goodies Caroline had listed. Having failed with the combination, Max falls back on drilling to crack the safe, grimacing as he withdraws the bit from the door. Next, he dons dark goggles and tries to cut his way in with an arc welder, but the welding doesn't go well. At home, Monica takes a sauce bottle from the fridge and hands it to Jackson. Meanwhile, Charlene takes a red camisole off a shop dummy and kisses its left breast, then comes to the dummy modeling the mink stole, which is too tall for her to reach. After jumping up and down a bit, she catches her breath and spots another mannequin holding a golf club. She takes the club and tries to remove the stole from around the dummy's neck with it, but it won't budge. Eventually, she gives up and uses the club like an ax to chop the dummy's legs off. Down in the office, Max has resorted to brute force and uses a sledgehammer on the safe door. Max doesn’t crack the safe, but Charlene succeeds in felling the dummy and takes the stole from around its neck. Max listens to the back of the safe and taps it as Charlene comes into the office just as Max emerges from around the back of the safe.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Marcus and Willie are in the study, where a bookshelf leads up to the ceiling fan. Willie snaps a firecracker, causing Marcus to glare at him. While the guard bids farewell to diners, Marcus crawls through the fan. Once Willie and the last of the diners have gone, the security guard checks his phone and taps a code into the intercom system. Marcus is in the ventilation shaft overlooking the reception desk and presses a button on a game controller, switching off all the intercom speakers, then hurries back along the shaft. He plunges down the shaft, heading straight down, and smashes through a trapdoor above a pile of pillows Lois had repositioned to break his fall. The pile collapses, and he leaps to his feet, running to the intercom console and turning it off with two seconds to spare. A revolving door opens, and Marcus and Willie step out, Willie towing a cart of locksmith tools. They break into a library, and Marcus walks over to a large cabinet, with Willie staring at it aghast. Still staring at the cabinet, Willie sits down, and later he tries to crack the lock, while Marcus wheels a dolly through the arcade. At home, Thurmond carefully lays the table for dinner and selects a bottle of soda. Marcus is on his annual shopping spree, helping himself to all the various knick-knacks Lois had listed. Having failed with the lock, Willie falls back on chiseling to open the cabinet, grimacing as he withdraws the chisel from the door. Next, he dons dark goggles and tries to cut his way in with a blowtorch, but the torching doesn't go well. At home, Sue takes a condiment bottle from the pantry and hands it to Thurmond. Meanwhile, Marcus takes a red dress off a shop dummy and kisses its left shoulder, then comes to the dummy modeling the feather boa, which is too tall for him to reach. After jumping up and down a bit, he catches his breath and spots another mannequin holding a tennis racket. He takes the racket and tries to remove the boa from around the dummy's neck with it, but it won't budge. Eventually, he gives up and uses the racket like an ax to chop the dummy's legs off. Down in the library, Willie has resorted to brute force and uses a crowbar on the cabinet door. Willie doesn’t crack the cabinet, but Marcus succeeds in felling the dummy and takes the boa from around its neck. Willie listens to the back of the cabinet and taps it as Marcus comes into the library just as Willie emerges from around the back of the cabinet.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Marcus and Willie are in the back room, where a ladder descends down from the air vent. Willie waves a streamer, causing Marcus to grin at him. While the guard waves goodbye to shoppers, Marcus climbs into the vent. Once Willie and the last of the shoppers have left, the security guard glances at his watch and dances to a tune on the alarm system. Marcus is in the air conditioning duct overlooking the security booth and flicks a switch on a remote control, powering down all the security cameras, then dashes forward along the duct. He slides down the duct, heading straight down, and crashes through a vent above a table of sweaters Lois had rearranged to soften his fall. The table shatters, and he jumps to his feet, sprinting to the alarm console and deactivating it with two seconds to spare. A service elevator opens, and Marcus and Willie stroll out, Willie dragging a cart of safe-cracking equipment. They break into an office, and Marcus strolls over to a large safe, with Willie staring at it stunned. Still staring at the safe, Willie leans back, and later he fiddles with the combination, while Marcus rolls a handcart through the mall. At home, Thurmond meticulously arranges the table for dinner and selects a bottle of wine. Marcus is on his annual shopping spree, indulging in all the various goodies Lois had noted. Having struggled with the combination, Willie switches to chiseling to break the safe, wincing as he removes the drill bit from the door. Next, he wears dark goggles and attempts to burn his way in with a blowtorch, but the torching doesn't go well. At home, Sue grabs a sauce bottle from the fridge and hands it to Thurmond. Meanwhile, Marcus takes a red camisole off a shop dummy and pats its left breast, then comes to the dummy modeling the mink stole, which is too high for him to reach. After hopping up and down a bit, he catches his breath and notices another mannequin holding a golf club. He grabs the club and tries to loosen the stole from around the dummy's neck with it, but it won't budge. Eventually, he gives up and uses the club like a sword to slice the dummy's legs off. Down in the office, Willie has resorted to sheer determination and swings a mallet on the safe door. Willie doesn’t open the safe, but Marcus manages to topple the dummy and removes the stole from around its neck. Willie listens to the back of the safe and raps it as Marcus enters the office just as Willie appears from around the back of the safe.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Jason and Lucy are in the front yard, where a bookshelf leads up to the chimney. Lucy snaps a pencil, causing Jason to smirk at her. While the chef bids farewell to waiters, Jason sails through the chimney. Once Lucy and the last of the waiters have gone, the chef checks his calendar and taps a code into the intercom system. Jason is in the ventilation shaft overlooking the manager's lounge and presses a lever on a handheld device, switching off all the streetlights, then hurries back along the shaft. He plunges down the shaft, heading straight down, and smashes through a skylight above a stack of pillows Tess had rearranged to break his fall. The stack collapses, and he leaps to his feet, running to the control panel and turning it off with two seconds to spare. A revolving door opens, and Jason and Lucy step out, Lucy towing a crate of painting materials. They break into a cabin, and Jason walks over to a large chest, with Lucy staring at it aghast. Still staring at the chest, Lucy sits down, and later she tries to unlock the combination, while Jason wheels a shopping cart through the plaza. At school, Raymond carefully lays the mat for a picnic and selects a carton of milk. Jason is on his annual treasure hunt, helping himself to all the various trinkets Tess had listed. Having failed with the combination, Lucy falls back on sawing to open the chest, grimacing as she withdraws the blade from the lid. Next, she dons dark glasses and tries to slice her way in with a laser cutter, but the slicing doesn't go well. At school, Dora takes a ketchup bottle from the pantry and hands it to Raymond. Meanwhile, Jason takes a blue scarf off a coat hanger and kisses its right cuff, then comes to the hanger showcasing the leather jacket, which is too wide for him to wrap around. After jumping up and down a bit, he catches his breath and spots another hanger holding a baseball bat. He takes the bat and tries to remove the jacket from around the hanger's shoulders with it, but it won't budge. Eventually, he gives up and uses the bat like a saw to chop the hangar's base off. Down in the cabin, Lucy has resorted to brute force and uses a crowbar on the chest lid. Lucy doesn’t unlock the chest, but Jason succeeds in felling the hanger and takes the jacket from around its shoulders. Lucy listens to the back of the chest and taps it as Jason comes into the cabin just as Lucy emerges from around the back of the chest.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Janet and Larry are in the front garden, where a tunnel winds down to the cellar. Larry rings a buzzer, prompting Janet to chuckle at him. While the janitor greets passersby, Janet tiptoes through the cellar. Once Larry and the last of the passersby have left, the janitor glances at his phone and inputs a code into the sprinkler system. Janet is in the ventilation shaft overlooking the janitor's closet and flicks a switch on a handheld device, turning off all the ceiling lights, then dashes back along the shaft. She slides down the shaft, heading straight down, and crashes through a ceiling above a shelf of socks Ned had rearranged to break her fall. The shelf crumbles, and she springs to her feet, sprinting to the light switch and flipping it off with two seconds to spare. A service hatch opens, and Janet and Larry emerge, Larry pushing a cart of painting supplies. They sneak into a cabin, and Janet strolls over to a large wardrobe, with Larry gaping at it in disbelief. Still gaping at the wardrobe, Larry kneels down, and later he attempts to unlock the door, while Janet pulls a trolley through the plaza. At home, Pamela delicately decorates the cake for a party and chooses a bottle of champagne. Janet is on her annual art tour, helping herself to all the various paintings Ned had noted. Having struggled with the lock, Larry reverts to hammering to open the wardrobe, wincing as he removes the nail from the frame. Next, he wears tinted goggles and attempts to carve his way in with a jigsaw, but the cutting doesn't go well. At home, Greg retrieves a mustard jar from the pantry and passes it to Pamela. Meanwhile, Janet lifts a blue scarf off a store mannequin and pats its right shoulder, then arrives at the mannequin modeling the leather jacket, which is too high for her to reach. After hopping up and down a bit, she pauses to breathe and notices another mannequin holding a tennis racket. She grabs the racket and attempts to remove the jacket from around the mannequin’s shoulders with it, but it remains firm. Eventually, she resigns and uses the racket like a crowbar to snap the mannequin's arms off. Down in the cabin, Larry has shifted to brute strength and strikes the wardrobe door with a mallet. Larry doesn’t unlock the wardrobe, but Janet manages to topple the mannequin and takes the jacket from around its shoulders. Larry listens to the back of the wardrobe and knocks on it as Janet enters the cabin just as Larry emerges from behind the wardrobe.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Marcus and Willie are in the lounge, where a slide descends to the shoe closet. Willie snaps a rubber band, causing Marcus to frown at him. While the guard salutes the joggers, Marcus slithers through the closet. Once Willie and the last of the joggers have left, the security guard checks his phone and scribbles a note into the planner. Marcus is in the heating duct peering over the security console and flicks a switch on a game controller, turning on all the disco lights, then scurries back along the duct. He tumbles down the duct, heading directly downward, and crashes through a window above a bench of scarves Lois had rearranged to soften his landing. The bench buckles, and he springs to his feet, dashing to the control panel and disabling it with two breaths to spare. An escalator opens, and Marcus and Willie step out, Willie pulling a wagon of painting supplies. They push into a pantry, and Marcus strolls over to a huge trunk, with Willie gaping at it flabbergasted. Still gaping at the trunk, Willie reclines, and then he attempts to paint the exterior, while Marcus pedals a scooter through the arcade. At home, Thurmond gingerly decorates the dining table for dessert and chooses a bottle of cider. Marcus is on his annual crafting spree, helping himself to all the diverse treats Lois had suggested. Having flopped with the painting, Willie reverts to sanding to alter the trunk, grimacing as he lifts the disc from the lid. Next, he dons pink headphones and attempts to polish his way in with a belt sander, but the sanding goes awry. At home, Sue takes a pickle jar from the cupboard and hands it to Thurmond. Meanwhile, Marcus takes a blue scarf off a shop mannequin and pats its right shoulder, then approaches the mannequin wearing the velvet beret, which is too high for him to grab. After hopping up and down a bit, he catches his breath and notices another mannequin holding a tennis racket. He takes the racket and tries to knock the beret from around the mannequin's head with it, but it won't shift. Eventually, he gives up and uses the racket like a paddle to slice the mannequin's arms off. Down in the pantry, Willie has turned to sheer determination and uses a crowbar on the trunk lid. Willie doesn’t budge the trunk, but Marcus succeeds in toppling the mannequin and takes the beret from around its head. Willie listens to the bottom of the trunk and drums it as Marcus enters the pantry just as Willie surfaces from around the back of the trunk.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Leo and Benny are in the kitchen, where a staircase leads up to the ceiling panel. Benny strikes a match, causing Leo to frown at him. While the chef waves goodbye to diners, Leo slides through the panel. Once Benny and the last of the diners have left, the doorman checks his sundial and inputs a sequence into the music player. Leo is in the heating duct overlooking the reception desk and turns a knob on a handheld device, shutting off all the sprinkler systems, then scurries back along the duct. He swan dives down the duct, heading straight down, and bursts through a panel above a stack of pillows Linda had arranged to cushion his landing. The pile crumbles, and he bounces to his feet, sprinting to the control board and deactivating it with two moments to spare. An attic door slides open, and Leo and Benny stride out, Benny hauling a wagon of pastry-making tools. They sneak into a laboratory, and Leo wanders over to a massive wardrobe, with Benny gaping at it in disbelief. Still staring at the wardrobe, Benny slumps down, and later he attempts to decipher the puzzle, while Leo rolls a skateboard through the arcade. At the cottage, Trevor meticulously sets the stage for an evening feast and pours a draft of cider. Leo is on his yearly culinary excursion, gathering all the delectable treats Linda had mentioned. Having stumbled with the puzzle, Benny resorts to chiseling to unlock the wardrobe, squinting as he removes the spike from the surface. Next, he wears tinted spectacles and attempts to pry his way in with a blowtorch, but the cutting fails. At the cottage, Sarah pulls a ketchup bottle from the icebox and passes it to Trevor. Meanwhile, Leo pulls a blue blouse off a mannequin and kisses its right shoulder, then spots the mannequin displaying the velvet blazer, which is too elevated for him to seize. After hopping a bit, he regains composure and notices another mannequin gripping a tennis racket. He takes the racket and tries to pry the blazer from around the mannequin's torso with it, but it remains stuck. Eventually, he abandons the effort and wields the racket like a sword to slice the mannequin's legs off. Down in the laboratory, Benny has resorted to raw strength and swings a crowbar at the wardrobe door. Benny doesn’t unlock the wardrobe, but Leo triumphs in toppling the mannequin and pulling the blazer from around its torso. Benny listens to the rear of the wardrobe and taps it as Leo arrives in the laboratory just as Benny steps out from around the side of the wardrobe.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Marcus and Willie plan a heist in a mall. While Willie distracts, Marcus disables security cameras and escapes through the duct to disable the alarm just in time. They reach an office where Willie attempts to crack a safe. At home, Thurmond prepares dinner. Marcus, on his annual spree, gathers merchandise Lois listed, even struggling with a mannequin for a mink stole, eventually using a golf club to chop its legs off. Meanwhile, Willie unsuccessfully uses various methods, including an arc welder, to open the safe. Despite Willie's failure with brute force, Marcus secures the stole and returns as Willie continues to work on the safe.

test_cases.description: Marcus is on his annual shopping spree helping himself to all the various goodies Lois had listed  Having failed with the combination Willie falls back on drilling to crack the safe grimacing as he withdraws the bit from the door  Next he dons dark goggles and tries to cut his way in with an arc welder but the welding doesn't go well  At home Sue takes a sauce bottle from the fridge and hands it to Thurmond  Meanwhile Marcus takes a red camisole off a shop dummy and kisses its left breast  then comes to the dummy modeling the mink stole which is too tall for him to reach  After jumping up and down a bit he catches his breath and spots another mannequin holding a golf club  He takes the club and tries to remove the stole from around the dummy's neck with it but it won't budge  Eventually he gives up and uses the club like an ax to chop the dummy's legs off  Down in the office Willie has resorted to brute force and uses a sledgehammer on the safe door  Willie doesn’t crack the safe but Marcus succeeds in felling the dummy and takes the stole from around its neck  Willie listens to the back of the safe and taps it as Marcus comes into the office just as Willie emerges from around the back of the safe Marcus and Willie are in the back room where a ladder leads up to the air vent  Willie snaps a popper causing Marcus to glare at him  While the guard bids farewell to shoppers Marcus crawls through the vent  Once Willie and the last of the shoppers have gone the security guard checks his watch and taps a code into the alarm system  Marcus is in the air conditioning duct overlooking the security booth and presses a button on a remote control switching off all the security cameras then hurries back along the duct  He plunges down the duct heading straight down and smashes through a vent above a table of sweaters Lois had repositioned to break his fall  The table collapses and he leaps to his feet running to the alarm console and turning it off with two seconds to spare  A service elevator opens and Marcus and Willie step out  Willie towing a trolley of safecracking equipment  They break into an office and Marcus walks over to a large safe with Willie staring at it aghast  Still staring at the safe Willie sits down and later he tries to crack the combination while Marcus wheels a handcart through the mall  At home Thurmond carefully lays the table for dinner and selects a bottle of wine
